column4: I have an asus m4a88t-m/usb3.0 board how do I check to make sure the correct drivers are installed for the soundcard to support the HD Audio because I have it going to my surround sound and it sounds like shit all crackly
sound drivers are in the kernel, so there's hardly anything you can do about it
and, fwiw, the ASUS M4N line (in my case, an M4N68T) work no problem
though I can only run the HD audio device in legacy AC97 mode because my case has no proper HD connectors
sound sounds fine when I have it set to go through the vc hdmi and comeo ut the tv speakers
but if it's on the setting for the sdcard and for sound to come out through the surround sound, it sounds like shit
does sound work ok from live CD?
depends on how I play it
I have two options in hardware internal audio and juniper hdmi audio
juniper hdmi audio plays perfect which comes through the HDTV
Internal Audio is all jacked up
the internal audio is plugged into the home theatre systems reciever
that shouldn't make a difference, you could also just hook up a pair of headphones
that would defeat the whole purpose of playing music through the surround sound
